content.topics: Overview of AI and ML concepts, Historical background and development, Applications of AI/ML in various fields
Introduction to Python programming language, Data types, variables, and operators, Control flow statements (if, else, loops), Functions and modules
Fundamentals of linear algebra, Calculus essentials (derivatives, gradients), Probability theory and statistics

Introduction to supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning, Basic concepts: training, testing, evaluation, Overview of common ML algorithms (linear regression, logistic regression, k-nearest neighbors)
Data cleaning and preprocessing techniques, Exploratory data analysis (EDA), Data visualization using libraries like Matplotlib and Seaborn
Understanding model complexity and overfitting, Introduction to ensemble methods (random forests, boosting), Cross-validation and hyperparameter tuning
Introduction to neural networks and deep learning, Basics of TensorFlow or PyTorch frameworks, Building and training simple neural networks
Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for image recognition, Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) for sequence modeling, Transfer learning and pre-trained models
Introduction to NLP tasks (tokenization, POS tagging, named entity recognition), Word embeddings and word2vec, Sequence-to-sequence models and attention mechanisms
Fundamentals of reinforcement learning, Markov Decision Processes (MDPs), Q-learning, Deep Q-Networks (DQN)
Introduction to GANs and their applications, Training GANs: adversarial training process, Variants of GANs (e.g., DCGAN, WGAN)
Model deployment and serving, Explainable AI and interpretability, AI ethics and societal impact

content.duration: Week 34-36 Project Planning and Data Collection
content.topics: Identifying project ideas and objectives, Collecting and preprocessing data for the project
Implementing machine learning or deep learning models for the project, Experimenting with different architectures and hyperparameters
Evaluating model performance and results, Creating visualizations and reports, Presenting the project findings to peers or stakeholders
